result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad J. Hembrook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before April 27, 2015.
Consecutive to: any other sentence or commitment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad J. Hembrook

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad J. Hembrook in court with attorney Mowris for Erika L Bierma.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend Count 1 961.41(3g)(b).  Dismiss/ read in Count 2.    No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1: As amended.
$243.00 costs and $200.00 surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
7 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  
Paperwork handed in court.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cover Letter from Attorney Bierma to Br. 1

Defendant Chad J. Hembrook in court with attorney EN.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. just appointed, need to reset matter.  State has no objection.  Court states matter is set for trial next week Br. 1.  Court advises to get substitution in and appearance is noted.  Court will reset matter for FPT and JT, remove from trial calendar.
Final pre-trial on September 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Atty Woodard acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.  Atty Woodard states DE will be in Jefferson Co Jail until August.  20 days to file motions.

Defendant Chad J. Hembrook in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states DE will waive prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Return date on May 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Newly appointed.  Attorney Woodard request new DA PTC/Rd.  State request appearance.  Court allows reset of PTC/RD.  Attorney Woodard advises defendant is in Jefferson Co. Jail.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Return date on April 1, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Chad J. Hembrook appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advises he will be retaining private counsel.  Court gives right to an attorney.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State request $350 cash bond.  Currently on a probation hold.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond due to a probation hold.  Defendant is employed. Time limits waived. $350.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Absolute sobriety and no taverns or liquor stores.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
